questions.question: SN2 reaction involving chiral electrophiles usually proceed with:

explanations.a: SN2 reactions involve backside attack, leading to inversion.
explanations.c: SN1 reactions may show slight inversion or retention, but not SN2.

questions.question:
Arrange the following in decreasing order of leaving group ability:
a) Br⁻
b) F⁻
c) I⁻
d) Cl⁻

explanations.a: Incorrect; F⁻ is a poor leaving group.
explanations.b: Incorrect; I⁻ is the best leaving group but F⁻ is worst.
explanations.c: c > a > d > b is more plausible.
explanations.d: Incorrect; Cl⁻ is not better than I⁻.

questions.question: Which of the following does NOT convert a 1°-hydroxyl group into a good leaving group for an SN2 reaction?

explanations.a: PBr₃ converts OH into Br, a good leaving group.
explanations.b: NaI does not directly activate OH groups.
explanations.c: SOCl₂ converts OH into Cl, a good leaving group.
explanations.d: CH₃SO₂Cl forms mesylates, which are excellent leaving groups.
